OMG portal is ridiculously fun but it requires 2 people to play for max enjoyment. It is a co-operative team building puzzle game where you are robots that need to coordinate movements and use of portals to strategically navigate a series of increasingly complex challenges. 

The first part is a tutorial that teaches you how to use your controller. The controller lets you create portals that you can travel through. You and your teammate will create portals to help you achieve certain objectives. The objectives you figure out as you play. They are obvious but figuring out how to achieve them can be challenging. For example: In the momentum level, you need to figure out a way to use momentum and portals to your advantage. 

You will have to complete tasks such as drop weights and complete tasks in timed sequence. It's a lot of fun!  I highly recommend playing it if you enjoy puzzles and problem solving.

This is a really great game. There is hardly anything to complain about. The only problem I have with it is that it runs slowly on older computers, and you have to decrease the graphics settings to the lowest settings.

(EDIT: I have now sunk the equivalent of more than 2 days into Portal 2, and it is still ENTIRELY recommended, especially on newer computers)
